definition: to have three meals a day
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: I was made to help cook twenty-eight meals three times a day.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫一日三餐帮助做二十八个人的饭菜。

sentences.english: You will need cut back in some areas, but you should still be able to eat every day.
sentences.chinese: 有些地方需要缩减开支，但一日三餐不能少。

sentences.english: William's boss was so mean that he only paid him three meals a day.
sentences.chinese: 威廉的老板很吝啬，他只付一日三餐饭。

sentences.english: I had pretty good friends, and three square meals a day.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多好朋友，一日三餐吃得也相当丰盛。

sentences.english: People on caloric restriction can eat three meals a day.
sentences.chinese: 实行热量限制的人们可以吃一日三餐。

sentences.english: Three-course meals in the best restaurants in the world are right up your alley.
sentences.chinese: 在世界上最高级的饭店里享受一日三餐感觉当然好了。

sentences.english: Chopsticks, the Chinese people can not live without three meals a day.
sentences.chinese: 筷子，中国人一日三餐离不了。

definition: plain tea and simple food/(fig.) bread and water
to eat and drink/food and drink
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
clothing, food, housing and transport (idiom); people's basic needs
